Summary: Bright orange light in the sky that disappeared then reappeared (could have been more than one)
trends: There have been no other sightings in Braintree
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsi was walking home one night at about half 11-ish, when i was about 200 meters from my house i looked up at the night sky and saw a very bright orange light shoot off in an northern direction as it did so it faded out initially i thought it was a sodium enriched meteorite so i continued on down the road about 2 seconds after i first saw the 'shooting star' i looked back in the rough area i saw the light this time i saw another orange light fly in a big z shape, by this time i had walked behind a tree and lost sight of it. (the start of the z was very close to the starting point of the first orange flash and ended way past the point where the first light faded out) thought it was a metiorite shower and i just saw 3 meteorites who's flight paths had just crossed each other, but then i thought if it was that the z shape wouldn't be continuous (which it was). there were no trails behind any of the flashes, it was just what looked like an separate orange light moving at a very fast speed, it didn't stop or even appear to slow down in the turns of the z shape. i live near a flight path so im used to seeing planes in the sky, this was definitely like no other i had ever seen, also it was travelling so fast i thought it was a shooting star so obviously moved a lot faster than any plane\helicopter\satellite another strange thing about it was it appeared to have an effect of my phone, i was on it as i saw the lights and it froze and lost all signal about 5 seconds before and after both the lights, i don't know if the lights caused this but it's a brand new phone that didn't do that before or since personally, am pretty sure it was some sort of e.t. ship.
